dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: America's Smartest Business Woman? That's a pretty bold claim for a pop star.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: America's Smartest Business Woman? That's a pretty bold claim for a pop star.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Well, she did make the cover of People magazine in 1990 with that exact headline. It's not just about the music, you know.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Well, she did make the cover of People magazine in nineteen ninety with that exact headline. It's not just about the music, you know.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: 1990: The year Madonna appeared on the cover of Forbes with the headline America's Smartest Business Woman?

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: I mean, sure, but a net worth of 190 million dollars? That's impressive, but is it really 'smartest' level?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: I mean, sure, but a net worth of one hundred ninety million dollars? That's impressive, but is it really 'smartest' level?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: $590 million: Madonnas net worth, as calculated this May by Forbes.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: And that was just this May, according to Forbes. Plus, she's ranked 46th among America's wealthiest self-made women. That's no small feat.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And that was just this May, according to Forbes. Plus, she's ranked forty sixth among America's wealthiest self-made women. That's no small feat.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: 36: Her rank among Americas wealthiest self-made women.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Okay, but what about recently? Zero shows since 2016? That doesn't sound very active.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Okay, but what about recently? Zero shows since twenty sixteen? That doesn't sound very active.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: 0: Number of shows played since the beginning of 2017.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: True, but her tours have been massive money-makers. Pollstar says her average gross per stop was over three million dollars in the past three years.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: True, but her tours have been massive money-makers. Pollstar says her average gross per stop was over three million dollars in the past three years.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: $3,044,574: Madonnas average gross per tour stop over the past 36 months, according to Pollstar.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Huh, that is a lot. But is she still relevant? Like, with younger audiences?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Huh, that is a lot. But is she still relevant? Like, with younger audiences?

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Absolutely! She still gets 1.6 million daily views on YouTube. Vogue alone has 80 million views.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Absolutely! She still gets one point six million daily views on YouTube. Vogue alone has eighty million views.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: 84 million: Total views for Vogue on YouTube.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Alright, you've got me there. But two Diamond albums? That's Like a Virgin and The Immaculate Collection, right?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Alright, you've got me there. But two Diamond albums? That's Like a Virgin and The Immaculate Collection, right?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: 2: Number of her albums certified Diamond by the RIAA for moving 10 million-plus units (Like a Virgin and The Immaculate Collection).

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly, both certified for moving over ten million units each. And she's got 28 Grammy nominations, with seven wins.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly, both certified for moving over ten million units each. And she's got twenty eight Grammy nominations, with seven wins.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: 28: Number of Grammy nominations earned by Madonna. 7: Grammy wins by Madonna.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Wow, okay. I heard about her place in Manhattan—three townhouses mashed together? Ten fireplaces?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Wow, okay. I heard about her place in Manhattan-three townhouses mashed together? Ten fireplaces?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: 9: Number of fireplaces in the aforementioned townhouse.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, purchased for 40 million back in 2009. And she's not just spending—she raised 7.5 million at one event in Miami for her pediatric hospital in Malawi.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, purchased for forty million back in two thousand nine. And she's not just spending-she raised seven point five million at one event in Miami for her pediatric hospital in Malawi.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: $7.5 million: Total raised by Madonna at a 2016 event in Miami to help fund her pediatric medical facility in Malawi.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, that's the facility that's performed over 1,600 surgeries?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, that's the facility that's performed over sixteen hundred surgeries?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: 1,690: Number of pediatric surgeries performed at the aforementioned facility since its opening.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: 1,690, actually, since it opened. So yeah, uh, maybe that 'smartest' title wasn't so far off after all.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: sixteen ninety, actually, since it opened. So yeah, uh, maybe that 'smartest' title wasn't so far off after all.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: 1,690: Number of pediatric surgeries performed at the aforementioned facility since its opening.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: You know, when you put it that way... I might have to agree with you.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: You know, when you put it that way... I might have to agree with you.

artist_script:
HostA: America's Smartest Business Woman? That's a pretty bold claim for a pop star.
HostB: Well, she did make the cover of People magazine in 1990 with that exact headline. It's not just about the music, you know.
HostA: I mean, sure, but a net worth of 190 million dollars? That's impressive, but is it really 'smartest' level?
HostB: And that was just this May, according to Forbes. Plus, she's ranked 46th among America's wealthiest self-made women. That's no small feat.
HostA: Okay, but what about recently? Zero shows since 2016? That doesn't sound very active.
HostB: True, but her tours have been massive money-makers. Pollstar says her average gross per stop was over three million dollars in the past three years.
HostA: Huh, that is a lot. But is she still relevant? Like, with younger audiences?
HostB: Absolutely! She still gets 1.6 million daily views on YouTube. Vogue alone has 80 million views.
HostA: Alright, you've got me there. But two Diamond albums? That's Like a Virgin and The Immaculate Collection, right?
HostB: Exactly, both certified for moving over ten million units each. And she's got 28 Grammy nominations, with seven wins.
HostA: Wow, okay. I heard about her place in Manhattan—three townhouses mashed together? Ten fireplaces?
HostB: Yeah, purchased for 40 million back in 2009. And she's not just spending—she raised 7.5 million at one event in Miami for her pediatric hospital in Malawi.
HostA: Oh, that's the facility that's performed over 1,600 surgeries?
HostB: 1,690, actually, since it opened. So yeah, uh, maybe that 'smartest' title wasn't so far off after all.
HostA: You know, when you put it that way... I might have to agree with you.
